snippet: Twenty schools remain without heat in New York City, causing parents to worry about the cold alongside their concerns about absences, which can hurt applications to selective middle and high schools.
abstract: Twenty schools remain without heat in New York City after Hurricane Sandy, causing parents to worry about the cold alongside already serious concerns about absences, which can hurt students' chances in applying to city's selective middle and high schools.

byline.contributor: Alex Vadukul and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Twenty schools remain without heat in New York City, causing parents to worry about the cold alongside their concerns about absences, which can hurt applications to selective middle and high schools.

headline.seo: Parents Weigh Dangers of Cold Classrooms Against Risks of Missing Class
headline.main: Weighing Dangers of Cold Classrooms Against Risks of Missing Class
headline.print_headline: Parents Weigh Dangers of Cold Classrooms Against Risks of Missing Class
